result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Johnson, Sirron O
defendant.address: 200 S Peach Avenue Lower, Marshfield, WI 54449

records.addlTxt:
10:46 AM Defendant Sirron O Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Sirron O Johnson.  Attorney Craig Lambert in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court notes that competency report indicates that defendant is now competent to proceed.
Attorney Slattery states that he is not contesting doctor's report and feels defendant is competent. Attorney Lambert states he has no evidence to the contrary.
Court questions defendant and feels that he is competent. Court finds that defendant is now competent to proceed.
Matter will be set for FPT. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Cover Sheet for Confidential Records w/ Competency Report
Order for Competency Examination of Department of Health Services
Order for Competency Examination of Department of Health Services
Competency hearing on September 30, 2022 at 10:45 am.

10:03 AM Defendant Sirron O Johnson appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Sirron O Johnson.  Attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Slattery is requesting a competency evaluation. State has no comment.
Court orders competency evaluation. Attorney Slattery will draft order.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:26 AM Defendant Sirron O Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Sirron O Johnson.  Attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Jesse Tlachac is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Oswald. On 5/9/22 he was dispatched to a residence in the city of Marshfield regarding a disturbance. He reviewed Officer Erikson's report. He states that defendant was at the residence and he gave a false name.  He spoke to T.B. and seemed to be afraid of defendant. She asked to be arrested so it would not look like she would be cooperating with law enforcement because defendant may kill her.  She gave law enforcement defendant's real name. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. T.B. indicated that defendant had hit and bit her earlier in the day. Officer Erickson observed injuries on T.B. She told officers of other incidents of abuse. One occurred on 12/24/21 at Wal-Mart. He arrested defendant on 5/9/22 and while in transport to the jail, he because upset and threatened to harm or kill them. Attorney Slattery cross-examines witness.  
Attorney Slattery makes statement and does not feel there is probable cause for count 2.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Not guilty plea to all counts. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on May 31, 2022 at 11:15 am.

10:03 AM Defendant Sirron O Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Sirron O Johnson.  Attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Due to technical problems, Preliminary hearing will be rescheduled. Court questions defendant and he agrees to have matter reset.
Court finds good cause to reset preliminary hearing. Bond is continued.
Document 8 was deleted. Attorney Slattery stated that it was filed in error.
No contact with victim or their residence (TAB) (TRB). Do not leave the State of Wisconsin. $10,000
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on May 23, 2022 at 10:15 am.
No contact w/victim or their residence (TAB) (TRB). Do not leave the State of Wisconsin.
